results.adx_keywords: Elections;Presidential Election of 2020;Graham, Lindsey;Trump, Donald J;Atlanta (Ga)
results.title: Federal Appeals Court Halts Graham Testimony Before Atlanta Grand Jury
results.abstract: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit temporarily blocked Senator Lindsey Graham from testifying before a special grand jury investigating Donald Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election results in Georgia.

media.caption: A federal appeals court temporarily blocked Senator Lindsey Graham, Republican of South Carolina, on Sunday from having to testify before a special grand jury in Atlanta.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only-nl;News and News Media;Television;Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Books and Literature;Stirewalt, Chris;Trump, Donald J;Fox News Channel;Republican Party;Arizona
results.byline: By Blake Hounshell and Jeremy W. Peters
results.title: A Former Fox News Insider Spills the Beans
results.abstract: Chris Stirewalt was part of a pivotal decision to declare Joe Biden the winner of Arizona in 2020. Now he’s speaking out about a network he says incites “black-helicopter-level paranoia and hatred.”

media.caption: Chris Stirewalt, a former Fox News journalist, appeared in June before the House committee investigating the Capitol riot.
media.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Children and Childhood;Child Abuse and Neglect;Computers and the Internet;Photography;Child Pornography;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Search and Seizure;Computer Security;Privacy;Google Inc
results.title: A Dad Took Photos of His Naked Toddler for the Doctor. Google Flagged Him as a Criminal.
results.abstract: Google has an automated tool to detect abusive images of children. But the system can get it wrong, and the consequences are serious.

media.caption: Mark with his son this month.
media.copyright: Aaron Wojack for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;Busey, Gary;Cherry Hill (NJ)
results.title: Gary Busey Faces Sex Charges After Appearance at Film Convention
results.abstract: The actor, 78, was a featured guest at Monster-Mania Con in Cherry Hill, N.J. He was charged with two counts of criminal sexual contact, among other counts, the police said.

media.caption: The actor Gary Busey, who earned an Oscar nomination for his role in the 1978 film “The Buddy Holly Story,” was charged on Saturday, the police said.
media.copyright: Chris Maggio for The New York Times

results.title: There Is No Happy Ending to America’s Trump Problem
results.abstract: We seem to be in a situation with no unambivalently good options.

media.copyright: Illustration by Mark Harris; photograph by Scott Olson via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Mikayla Paulus;Adam Simjee;Yasmine Hider;Krystal Diane Pinkins;Alabama;Talladega National Forest
results.title: Student Fatally Shot by Woman He Stopped to Help
results.abstract: Adam Simjee was with his girlfriend in a national forest in Alabama when a woman flagged them down, claiming she had car trouble.

media.caption: Adam Simjee and his girlfriend Mikayla Paulus. Mr. Simjee died in an exchange of gunfire last week after a woman pretending to be a stranded driver forced them into the woods.
media.copyright: GoFundMe

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Assassinations and Attempted Assassinations;Dugin, Alexander (1962- );Putin, Vladimir V;Moscow (Russia);Russia;Ukraine
results.title: Brazen Attack Near Moscow Rattles Russians
results.abstract: The daughter of a prominent ultranationalist, herself a hawkish commentator, was killed by a car bomb deep in Russian territory.

media.caption: A photo provided by the Russian government shows investigators at the site of a car bombing outside Moscow that killed a political commentator.
media.copyright: Russian Investigative Committee, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Archives and Records;Search and Seizure;Presidential Transition (US);United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;National Archives and Records Administration;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla)
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Katie Benner and Glenn Thrush
results.title: The Final Days of the Trump White House: Chaos and Scattered Papers
results.abstract: Government documents that President Donald J. Trump had accumulated were with him in roughly two dozen boxes in the White House residence. They were to go to the National Archives, but at least some ended up in Florida.

media.caption: President Donald J. Trump and his wife, Melania, leaving the White House for the last time on Jan. 20, 2021.
media.copyright: Anna Moneymaker for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Putin, Vladimir V;Telegram LLC;Crimea (Ukraine);Moscow (Russia);Sevastopol (Ukraine);Russia;Ukraine;Zaporizhzhia (Ukraine)
results.byline: By Anton Troianovski, Marc Santora and Dan Bilefsky
results.title: As Attacks Mount in Crimea, Kremlin Faces Rising Domestic Pressures
results.abstract: With the drumbeat of Ukrainian strikes inside Russian-held territory, the visceral reality of war is becoming increasingly apparent to Russians.

media.caption: Daniel Babii, 18, with the 112 Brigade of the Ukrainian Territorial Defense, talks with his girlfriend on Saturday before deploying to the front lines in eastern Ukraine.
media.copyright: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Zaslav, David M;Discovery Channel;HBO Max;Warner Bros Discovery
results.title: HBO Max Pulls Nearly 200 ‘Sesame Street’ Episodes
results.abstract: HBO Max took down classic episodes of “Sesame Street” as it prepares to combine with Discovery+. The move came as a surprise to fans, who worried about what it signals.

media.caption: Most of the “Sesame Street” episodes removed from HBO Max aired before 2008.
media.copyright: Landon Nordeman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Law and Legislation;States (US);Doctors;Center for Reproductive Rights;Baton Rouge (La);Louisiana
results.byline: By Ava Sasani and Emily Cochrane
results.title: ‘I’m Carrying This Baby Just to Bury It’: The Struggle to Decode Abortion Laws
results.abstract: At a Louisiana hospital, concerns about complying with new abortion bans in post-Roe America left a pregnant woman with a devastating diagnosis, but not an abortion.

media.caption: After a recent court ruling that allowed Louisiana’s abortion bans to go into effect, the abortion provider Hope Medical Group for Women in Shreveport said that it would move out of the state.
media.copyright: Emily Kask for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Spotted Lanternflies;Invasive Species;Schumer, Charles E;People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals
results.title: In the Lanternfly War, Some Take the Bug’s Side
results.abstract: Even as the invasive pest spreads across 11 states and threatens agriculture, lanternflies are winning sympathizers who resist kill-on-sight orders.
org_facet: People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals

media.caption: A dead lanternfly seen in downtown Manhattan. The bug, originally from Asia, has spread across the region.
media.copyright: Hiroko Masuike/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Drugstores;Careers and Professions;Wages and Salaries;Working Hours;Hiring and Promotion;Labor and Jobs;Workplace Hazards and Violations;CVS Caremark Corporation;Walgreen Co
results.title: How Pharmacy Work Stopped Being So Great
results.abstract: Two years of economic recovery brought strong gains to workers at the top and the bottom, but headwinds for those in between. Consider the pharmacist.

media.copyright: Albert Tercero

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Coaches and Managers;Content Type: Personal Profile;Molina, Yadier;St Louis Cardinals
results.title: After 19 Years of ‘Managing,’ He Finally Gets to Be a Manager
results.abstract: When Yadier Molina’s playing career ends this fall, he’ll head to Venezuela to coach. His qualifications? “I’ve managed for 19 years in the big leagues.”

media.copyright: Aaron Doster/Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Gender;Homosexuality and Bisexuality;Books and Literature;Vincent, Norah
results.title: Norah Vincent, Who Chronicled Passing as a Man, Is Dead at 53
results.abstract: Her best-selling 2006 book about that experience, “Self-Made Man,” made her a media darling. But it cost her psychologically.

media.caption: Norah Vincent in 2001 in her neighborhood on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. For a book, she spent 18 months living as a man named Ned, putting him in hypermasculine situations.
media.copyright: Chester Higgins Jr./The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Missing Persons;Politics and Government;Murillo Karam, Jesus;Lopez Obrador, Andres Manuel;Pena Nieto, Enrique;Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico);Mexico;Iguala (Mexico)
results.title: Mexico Arrests Top Prosecutor in Case of Missing Students and Issues 80 Warrants
results.abstract: The country’s former attorney general, accused of covering up the probable massacre of 43 students, was charged with forced disappearance, torture and obstruction of justice.
org_facet: Escuela Normal Rural Raul Isidro Burgos (Guerrero, Mexico)

media.caption: A mass grave in Guerrero, Mexico, where 28 bodies were found in 2014. The remains of only three of the missing 43 students have ever been identified.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Appraisals and Valuation (Property);Black People;Discrimination;Race and Ethnicity;Mortgages;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Baltimore (Md);Maryland
results.title: Home Appraised With a Black Owner: $472,000. With a White Owner: $750,000.
results.abstract: Nathan Connolly and his wife, Shani Mott, say an appraisal company undervalued their home based on their race. The couple has filed a lawsuit in Maryland.

media.caption: Nathan Connolly and Shani Mott are suing an appraiser and a mortgage lender after their Baltimore home was estimated to be worth $472,000. After the couple removed any indications that Black people lived there, a second appraiser valued the home at $750,000.
media.copyright: Shan Wallace for The New York Times

results.title: ‘I am glad it is sitting here demolished’: Kyiv rolls out damaged Russian tanks.
results.abstract: Crowds took photos and children climbed amid the missile launchers and armed vehicles at an event that was a show of defiance in Ukraine’s capital.

media.copyright: Jim Huylebroek for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Endorsements;Politics and Government;Elections, State Legislature;Primaries and Caucuses;Bail;State Legislatures;Adams, Eric L;Democratic Socialists of America;Democratic Party;New York City;New York State
results.title: Adams Endorses Primary Candidates, Hoping to Defeat Left-Wing Democrats
results.abstract: The mayor has chosen sides in at least 10 primaries this year, as he looks to enact criminal justice changes and defeat left-leaning candidates.

media.caption: Mayor Eric Adams has said New York’s bail law is to blame for a surge in some serious crimes.
media.copyright: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;Conservatism (US Politics);Referendums;Midterm Elections (2022);Typography;Michigan
results.title: Group Seeks to Block Abortion Vote in Michigan, Citing Typography
results.abstract: The effort is aimed at keeping a constitutional amendment to guarantee abortion rights off the ballot. A voting access measure is also being challenged.

media.caption: Supporters of an abortion rights amendment in Michigan submitted more than 730,000 signatures, surpassing the roughly 425,000 required. They still need to be verified.
media.copyright: Emily Elconin/Reuters
